Author: ehloveeash
Text: I have this problem too. It doesn't matter what size the person is, I just subconsciously project my eating patterns on to them and over analyze their eating. Usually it has absolutely nothing to do with the person, it is  just my brain finding new extremes to explore the disorder in. Its like the brain has its personal philosophy and wants to apply it to everything to test the extremes and develop new issues based on this experimental self philosophy.

Author: KrypticKricket
Text: There's a good chance that you're projecting a lit of your stuff onto him but it also seems like he has super unhealthy eating habits.... that's going to be super triggering for you in the future... I also have a super thin bf that has no problem skipping or forgetting food. It drives me nuts. He's better at starving than I am and I've been diagnosed with anorexia and bulimia. Whenever I ask about dinner or something and he says oh I'm not that hungry, I literally feel like dying. It's a hard dynamic to be o m.h at with.
